title: As Trump Looks for Distraction on Epstein, Justice Dept. Rushes to His Aid
summary: The department was deployed, in effect, as an arm of the president’s rapid-response operation to help him muscle through a damaging news cycle over Jeffrey Epstein, former and current officials said.

title: The ‘Donroe Doctrine’: Trump’s Bid to Control the Western Hemisphere
summary: President Trump has tightened the U.S. grip on the Americas by rewarding allies and punishing rivals. That has upended the region’s politics.

title: New Passport Rule Sends Blunt and Sweeping Message to Trans Americans
summary: The Trump administration has said that the U.S. passports of transgender people must now reflect the sex on their original birth certificate, reversing a decades-old policy.

title: The Crypto Industry’s $28 Billion in ‘Dirty Money’
summary: As President Trump has championed crypto and the industry has gone mainstream, funds from scammers and other criminal groups have flowed onto major crypto exchanges.

title: How Fraudsters Use Cryptocurrency A.T.M.s to Target Victims
summary: The kiosks, which resemble conventional A.T.M.s and convert cash into virtual currencies, are increasingly under scrutiny as a tool for scammers.

title: How to Not Get Kidnapped for Your Bitcoin
summary: Escaping zipties, hiring bodyguards and other practical lessons in self-defense for crypto traders, after a series of gruesome crimes spooked the community.

title: U.S. Border Patrol Arrested 81 People in Charlotte, N.C.
summary: Border Patrol agents descended on Charlotte over the weekend, searching for immigrants who are in the country illegally. It remains unclear how long the agents will stay.

title: At Catholic Churches, Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Takes Center Stage
summary: Immigration was on the minds of priests and parishioners following a letter from the nation’s Catholic bishops decrying how immigrants are being treated.

title: New International Student Enrollment Plummeted This Fall, Survey Finds
summary: The overall number of international students enrolled in U.S. colleges and universities, including those who enrolled in prior years or who are working after graduation, fell only slightly.

title: Andy Baraghani’s Thanksgiving Menu Is Bright, Colorful and Delicious
summary: Andy Baraghani’s bright, brilliant menu is a feast for the eyes, too.

title: A Councilwoman Intervened During an ICE Arrest. Then She Faced the Voters.
summary: Months before the election, Etel Haxhiaj, a councilwoman in Worcester, Mass., was charged with assaulting an officer when she stood between the police and an immigrant family.

title: After Marshawn Kneeland’s Death, Cowboys Prepare to Take the Field Again
summary: Marshawn Kneeland spent nearly all of his 24 years working to get to the N.F.L. He died two days after scoring his first touchdown.

title: Ukraine’s Cash Is Running Low, and Europe Has No Good Plan B
summary: The European Union wants to finance Ukraine’s war efforts using a loan based on Russia’s frozen assets in Belgium. If that falls through, there’s no easy alternative.

title: Zelensky Ousted a Heavyweight Mayor. Was It a Power Grab?
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky removed Odesa’s mayor, raising fears he might be using his wartime powers to tighten control over opposition-run cities.

title: France Agrees to Sell Up to 100 Rafale Fighter Jets to Ukraine
summary: Some in Ukraine criticized the 10-year timeline for the warplanes and other defense equipment, but France called it a long-term commitment to the country.

title: These Six Artworks Could Predict the Auction Market
summary: The art market had a summer of closures and consolidations. But major collections, blue-chip art and guarantees have pushed expectations high for the marquee sales.

title: Europe Begins Rethinking Its Crackdown on Big Tech
summary: European policymakers are crafting changes to scale back and simplify landmark rules for A.I. and data privacy, in a shift from an aggressive regulatory period.

title: A Bailout May Come Too Late as Farmers Begin to Plan for Next Year
summary: It could be months before they receive aid, well after the winter period when they talk to their bankers and make decisions about the planting ahead.

title: New York’s Bodegas Are Here to Stay
summary: The iconic corner store is perhaps the ultimate symbol of a city constantly evolving and on the move.

title: An Officer Bungled a Teen Rape Case. The Victim Was Abused Again.
summary: The investigator, who did not believe the teen, faced little punishment, illustrating the different ways that officers in New York State are disciplined for misconduct.

title: We Can Now Track Individual Monarch Butterflies. It’s a Revelation.
summary: Scientists used tiny new sensors to follow the insects on journeys that take thousands of miles to their winter colonies in Mexico.

title: We Immigrated Legally. ICE Detained Us Anyway.
summary: The brutal detention of three people who came to the U.S. legally reveals a cruel system that operates with impunity.

title: This Is How Our Economy Comes Crashing Down
summary: Some of the pieces seem fine, but the base is increasingly fragile.

title: Chaos at the Justice Department
summary: President Trump has transformed the agency. We look at what’s happening on the inside.

title: Hydropower Is Getting Less Reliable as the World Needs More Energy
summary: Demand for power is growing fast, but hydro plants, the oldest source of clean energy, are struggling because of droughts, floods and other extreme weather linked to climate change.

title: The Mayor of Secaucus Has a Fix for America: ‘Say Yes to Everyone’
summary: As South Asian and Muslim immigrants transform a small New Jersey town, the five-term mayor has managed to keep the peace. What happens when he’s gone?

title: Eric Adams Meets Netanyahu on Day 3 of Taxpayer-Funded Trip to Israel
summary: Mr. Adams, whose tenure as mayor of New York City ends in six weeks, is using his second trip to Israel in three years to reinforce his staunch support of the country.

title: Bangladesh Court Sentences Former Prime Minister to Death
summary: Sheikh Hasina, who is in exile in India, was convicted in absentia of crimes against humanity in connection with a bloody crackdown on protests last year.
